Demonstran Lebanon Blokir Jalanan Penting di Beirut
05 Nov 2019, 13:24 by Novi Christiastuti
Beirut - Para demonstran di Lebanon terus melanjutkan aksi protes mereka meskipun Perdana Menteri (PM) Saad al-Hariri telah mundur dari jabatannya. Dalam aksi terbaru, para demonstran berupaya memblokir ruas jalanan penting di Beirut.
Seperti dilansir AFP, Selasa (5/11/2019), dalam aksi kucing-kucingan dengan polisi antihuru-hara, para demonstran memblokir jalan dengan meletakkan sejumlah tempat sampah besar dan memarkirkan kendaraan di tengah jalanan.
Di Beirut, para demonstran duduk bersila di ruas jalanan flyover setempat dan berkumpul di dekat Bank Sentral Lebanon. Diketahui bahwa para demonstran menyalahkan Bank Sentral karena mengobarkan krisis ekonomi di Lebanon.
Sekolah-sekolah di Lebanon telah dibuka kembali setelah diliburkan selama beberapa pekan terakhir. Meskipun ada beberapa sekolah yang masih ditutup karena sebagian besar wilayah Lebanon masih lumpuh akibat unjuk rasa.
Diketahui bahwa unjuk rasa besar-besaran menyelimuti Lebanon sejak 17 Oktober lalu, yang menyerukan perombakan sistem politik yang dipandang tidak efisien dan korup. Protes yang diwarnai dengan aksi turun ke jalanan secara nasional, berhasil melengserkan pemerintahan dan dipandang sebagai kemenangan besar pertama para demonstran.
Setelah itu, para demonstran bersumpah akan tetap melanjutkan aksi protes hingga seluruh tuntutan mereka terpenuhi, termasuk salah satunya pembentukan pemerintah teknokratik.

Lebanese protesters block important streets in Beirut
05 Nov 2019, 13:24 by Novi Christiastuti
Beirut - Protesters in Lebanon continue their protests even though Prime Minister (PM) Saad al-Hariri has stepped down from his post. In the latest action, demonstrators tried to block important road sections in Beirut.
As reported by AFP on Tuesday (11/05/2019), in a cat-and-mouse action with riot police, the demonstrators blocked the road by placing a number of large trash cans and parked vehicles in the middle of the road.
In Beirut, demonstrators sat cross-legged on local flyover streets and gathered near the Central Bank of Lebanon. It is known that the demonstrators blamed the Central Bank for waging an economic crisis in Lebanon.
Schools in Lebanon have reopened after being closed for the past few weeks. Although there are some schools that are still closed because most of Lebanon is still paralyzed due to the demonstration.
It is known that large-scale protests have engulfed Lebanon since October 17, calling for an overhaul of a political system that was seen as inefficient and corrupt. The protest, which was marked by street actions nationwide, succeeded in overthrowing the government and was seen as the first major victory of the demonstrators.
After that, the demonstrators vowed to continue the protest until all their demands were met, including the formation of a technocratic government.
